result.academy_synopis: As Lili, Eddie Redmayne portrays an artist torn by the societal norms and restrictions of the early 20th century while trying to transition from male to female.

gallery.description: In the late 1920s, Danish landscape painter Einar Wegener poses as a female dancer for his wife, Gerda, while she waits for her model to arrive. Stirred by the experience and supported by Gerda, Einar begins a journey fraught with both emotional and physical peril as he transitions into his true self, a woman called Lili Elbe.

result.seo_page_title: Leonardo DiCaprio: Actor in a Leading Role - Oscar Nominees 2016
result.academy_synopis: Leonardo DiCaprio portrays Hugh Glass, a 19th-century American frontiersman who is left for dead by his comrades after being mauled by a bear during a winter expedition.

gallery.description: While on a danger-laden journey through the American wilderness in the early 1800s, frontiersman Hugh Glass is badly mauled by a grizzly and abandoned by his fellow trappers. Barely surviving his wounds, Glass is driven by thoughts of his family and a desire for revenge as he endures the frigid winter and pursues the men who left him for dead.

result.academy_synopis: Matt Damon plays Mark Watney, an astronaut stranded on Mars who must engineer the means to survive the planet's harsh environment long enough to be rescued.

gallery.description: Astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead and left behind when an unexpected storm hits Mars, forcing his crewmates to abandon their mission. Watney, a botanist, must engineer ways to feed himself and survive the harsh environment, and after he reestablishes communication with NASA, scientists around the globe race against time to rescue him.

result.seo_page_title: Christian Bale: Actor in a Supporting Role - Oscar Nominees 2016
result.academy_synopis: As Michael Burry, Christian Bale plays an eccentric money manager who anticipates the 2008 financial crisis and bets against the housing industry.

gallery.description: Four outsiders to Wall Street use what are sometimes perceived as eccentric insights into the U.S. financial markets to predict the meltdowns of the housing market and big banks in 2008. Betting together on the coming catastrophe, the quartet manages to invest shrewdly and amass a fortune, all while exposing the corruption of several large financial institutions.

result.academy_synopis: As Mike Rezendes, Mark Ruffalo plays a reporter on The Boston Globe's Spotlight team investigating the conspiracy surrounding sexual abuse committed by priests.

gallery.description: In 2001, the journalists of The Boston Globe's Spotlight team begin investigating Father John Geoghan, who is accused of molesting more than 80 boys. As they dig deeper and acknowledge their paper's own failings, the team uncovers a conspiracy of lawyers and government officials who helped the Boston Archdiocese hide the pedophilia of many priests and deny justice to the victims.

gallery.description: In 1957, in the midst of the Cold War, New York insurance lawyer James Donovan is enlisted to provide a pro-bono defense for Rudolf Abel, who is accused of spying for the Russians. The CIA then sends Donovan to East Berlin to conduct precarious negotiations with the Soviets to exchange Abel for a recently captured U.S. Air Force pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

result.academy_synopis: Brie Larson portrays Ma, a woman held captive in a small shed for seven years, who strives to create a normal life for her young son.

gallery.description: A young woman who has been held in captivity in a small shed for seven years tries to make as normal a life as she can for her five-year-old son, Jack, who knows her only as "Ma." When Ma and Jack escape their captor, Old Nick, they must cope with the outside world and forge relationships with Ma's conflicted family.

result.seo_page_title: Cate Blanchett: Actress in a Leading Role - Oscar Nominees 2016
result.academy_synopis: Cate Blanchett plays Carol Aird, a sophisticated housewife who is threatened with losing custody of her daughter because of her relationship with another woman.

gallery.description: In the early 1950s, department store clerk Therese Belivet is entranced by Carol Aird, a self-assured suburban housewife. As their relationship intensifies, Therese and Carol find themselves subjected to vehement scrutiny, especially by Carol's soon-to-be ex-husband, Harge, and Carol is pressured to abandon the affair in order to retain custody of her young daughter.

result.academy_synopis: Saoirse Ronan plays Eilis, a young woman who finds love after immigrating to America, although her relationship and feelings for her new country are tested when she returns to Ireland.

gallery.description: In 1952, Eilis Lacey leaves Ireland to immigrate to Brooklyn, where she has a better chance of finding work. Crushed by homesickness, Eilis finds her spirits lifted by an Italian-American suitor with whom she falls in love. When she must return to Ireland, Eilis is courted by a hometown boy and finds herself torn between two countries and the two men who love her.

result.seo_page_title: Inside Out: Animated Feature Film  Oscar Nominees 2016
result.academy_synopis: When 11-year-old Riley and her parents move to a new city, it's up to Riley's five main emotions -- Joy, Sadness, Fear, Anger and Disgust -- to help her adjust. Joy and Sadness are accidentally launched on a journey through Riley's brain to preserve her core memories, and as the duo races back to Headquarters, Fear, Anger and Disgust must figure out how to guide Riley.

result.academy_synopis: In 1957, in the midst of the Cold War, New York insurance lawyer James Donovan is enlisted to provide a pro-bono defense for Rudolf Abel, who is accused of spying for the Russians. The CIA then sends Donovan to East Berlin to conduct precarious negotiations with the Soviets to exchange Abel for a recently captured U.S. Air Force pilot, Francis Gary Powers.

result.academy_synopis: Twenty-something computer programmer Caleb wins a contest to spend a week at the isolated home of his boss, the CEO of the Internet's largest provider. Caleb is thrilled to meet Nathan, whom he idolizes, but quickly learns the real reason for his presence: to administer a Turing test that judges the consciousness and abilities of Ava, a female android created by Nathan.

result.post_content: Screenplay by Pete Docter, Meg LeFauve, Josh Cooley; Original story by Pete Docter, Ronnie del Carmen
result.academy_synopis: When 11-year-old Riley and her parents move to a new city, it's up to Riley's five main emotions -- Joy, Sadness, Fear, Anger and Disgust -- to help her adjust. Joy and Sadness are accidentally launched on a journey through Riley's brain to preserve her core memories, and as the duo races back to Headquarters, Fear, Anger and Disgust must figure out how to guide Riley.

result.seo_page_title: Spotlight: Writing Original Screenplay  Oscar Nominees 2016
result.post_content: Written by Josh Singer & Tom McCarthy
result.academy_synopis: In 2001, the journalists of The Boston Globe's Spotlight team begin investigating Father John Geoghan, who is accused of molesting more than 80 boys. As they dig deeper and acknowledge their paper's own failings, the team uncovers a conspiracy of lawyers and government officials who helped the Boston Archdiocese hide the pedophilia of many priests and deny justice to the victims.

result.post_content: Screenplay by Jonathan Herman and Andrea Berloff; Story by S. Leigh Savidge & Alan Wenkus and Andrea Berloff
result.academy_synopis: In the mid-1980s, five young men from Compton -- Ice Cube, Dr. Dre, Eazy-E, DJ Yella and MC Ren -- form a hip-hop group called N.W.A. As their music takes off, they attract the attention of veteran rock manager Jerry Heller, but the pressures of fame cause dissension among the bandmates, prompting them to pursue separate careers.
